intro: Lepianthes granulatum, commonly known as the granulated lepianthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rounded leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
